selected_quotes: Validating the Colorado Retinopathy of Prematurity screening algorithm #ROP #retina

citation.abstract:
The Colorado retinopathy of prematurity (CO-ROP) model is a novel screening algorithm that recommends screening for ROP in infants meeting the following criteria: gestational age ≤30 weeks, birth weight of ≤1500 g, and a net weight gain of ≤650 g between birth and 4 weeks of age. This study was performed to evaluate the validity of the CO-ROP model in a tertiary referral county hospital.
Three hundred seventy-four consecutive newborns screened for ROP using national screening guidelines at Parkland Hospital (Dallas, TX) from April 1, 2009 to August 30, 2013 were retrospectively applied to the CO-ROP model. Sensitivities and specificities for identifying ROP were calculated.
Out of 374 infants, 29 (7.8%) developed type 1 ROP and 12 (3.2%) developed type 2 ROP. The CO-ROP model would have decreased number of infants screened by 34% compared to current national screening criteria. CO-ROP had sensitivity of 93.1% (95% CI, 77.2-99.1) and 92.7% (95% CI, 61.5-99.8) for identifying type 1 and type 2 ROP, respectively. Two out of 29 patients who developed type 1 ROP were not identified using CO-ROP.
The CO-ROP model significantly reduced total number screened but failed to detect 2 infants with type I ROP. Further modification to this screening model is needed.
